snippet: Settlements for defrauding the government are on track to reach $8 billion this year, but relatively few executives are being charged at the companies getting the penalties.
abstract: Settlements for defrauding the government are on track to reach a record $8 billion this year, reflecting a renewed emphasis on corporate fraud, though relatively few executives are being charged at the companies getting the penalties; Pres Obama, lawmakers and government watchdog groups have called for holding more individual executives responsible.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and EDWARD WYATT

lead_paragraph: Settlements for defrauding the government are on track to reach $8 billion this year, but relatively few executives are being charged at the companies getting the penalties.

headline.seo: More Fraud Settlements for Companies, but Rarely Individuals
headline.main: Corporate Fraud Cases Often Spare Individuals
